definition: to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
to gaze/to view
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
back/behind/rear/afterwards/after/later/post-

sentences.english: He often looks before and after when he deals with problems.
sentences.chinese: 他處理問題時常常瞻前顧後。

sentences.english: You have to cultivate the habit of doing before knowing.
sentences.chinese: 你需要培養在瞻前顧後之前開始行動的習慣？

sentences.english: Cultivate the habit of surveying and testing a prospective action before undertaking it.
sentences.chinese: 在實際行動之前要養成瞻前顧後的習慣。

sentences.english: He said he's leaning toward retirement but goes back and forth.
sentences.chinese: 他說，他傾向於退休，但瞻前顧後的。

definition: lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to persist in one's views
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
spilt water is difficult to retrieve (idiom)/it's no use crying over spilt milk/what's done is done and can't be reversed/the damage is done/once divorced, there's no reuniting
to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
hidebound by convention (idiom)
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
unification and independence
to be shortsighted
to be reluctant to give up a post
skin-deep/superficial/shallow
